title: PAR-100 Epic: rforge logs high-fidelity syntax highlighting (harness-grade)
body: Deliver production-grade syntax highlighting in rforge logs matching dedicated harness quality (Codex/Claude/Opencode/Pi). Scope: CLI logs first, shared renderer reusable by TUI. Includes parser pipeline, semantic tokenization, ANSI theme system, performance constraints, and full regression coverage.

title: PAR-101 Logs corpus pack: Codex/Claude/Opencode/Pi real transcripts
body: Collect representative real logs from each harness (success, failure, code-fence, diff, stacktrace, tool-output). Store sanitized fixtures. Define expected token classes per line span. Exit when corpus covers >=50 distinct patterns and no unknown class in baseline scan.

title: PAR-102 Highlighting spec: token taxonomy + precedence + fallback rules
body: Write deterministic token model (timestamp, section header, role markers, cmd prompt, diff hunk/add/del, code fence, json key/value, error, warning, stack frame, path:line, URL). Define precedence and tie-breaks. Include no-color fallback behavior.

title: PAR-103 Harness-aware section parser state machine
body: Implement parser for harness structural blocks (thinking/planning, tool call blocks, summary tables, commit blocks). Must classify lines without regex backtracking blowups. Add unknown-block fallback preserving raw content.

title: PAR-104 Markdown/code-fence lexer with language detection
body: Implement fenced block detection (```lang), inline code spans, fence nesting guards. Detect language hints for rust/go/ts/js/python/json/yaml/toml/sh/diff. Keep streaming-safe state across chunk boundaries.

title: PAR-105 Diff renderer parity+: headers/hunks/intraline changes
body: Highlight diff metadata, file headers, hunk ranges, +/- lines, and intraline fragments. Support both unified diff and git-style patch snippets. Add tests for malformed diffs and large hunks.

title: PAR-106 Structured-data renderer: JSON/YAML/TOML semantic tokens
body: Semantic colorization for keys, strings, numbers, booleans, null, punctuation, comments (where format allows). Graceful fallback on invalid payloads. Stable colors under wrapping/truncation.

title: PAR-107 Command transcript renderer: prompt/cmd/stdout/stderr/exit
body: Detect shell prompt + command lines, annotate stdout/stderr streams, surface exit code markers. Highlight common command patterns (cargo/go/git/sv/forge/fmail). Preserve plain mode when ambiguous.

title: PAR-108 Error and stacktrace renderer
body: Highlight panic/traceback/exception blocks, stack frames, file:line:col refs, causal chains. Elevate actionable lines (first cause, failing assertion, command that failed).

title: PAR-109 Theme engine: ANSI16/ANSI256/truecolor + no-color policy
body: Create centralized palette + style map with deterministic token->style mapping. Support terminal capability tiers and explicit --no-color/NO_COLOR. Ensure readable contrast on light/dark terminals.

title: PAR-110 Streaming highlighter: incremental tail with state carry-over
body: Wire highlighter into follow-mode pipeline with incremental parsing, bounded buffers, and resume-safe state at arbitrary chunk cuts. Must avoid token flicker when new lines arrive.

title: PAR-111 Readability layer: headers/timestamps/grouping controls
body: Improve scanability: emphasize loop headers, normalize timestamp contrast, optional compact mode, optional section separators. Do not alter machine output modes.

title: PAR-112 Performance budget and optimization pass
body: Benchmark on large logs (>=100MB replay, >=10k lines/sec follow). Set and enforce budgets for latency, throughput, allocations. Add perf regression guard in CI test target.

title: PAR-113 Golden + property tests for highlighting engine
body: Add harness-specific golden snapshots and property/fuzz tests for escape codes, malformed UTF-8, long lines, partial fences. Require deterministic output across runs/platforms.

title: PAR-114 End-to-end rforge logs highlighting verification suite
body: E2E tests for logs, logs -f, --since, --lines, prefix-selection, ambiguous-prefix errors. Assert semantic coloring output (or token stream) against fixtures.

title: PAR-115 Operator docs: highlighting behavior, limits, customization
body: Document highlighting model, flags/env controls, known limitations, performance guidance, and troubleshooting (including NO_COLOR and terminal capability issues).

title: PAR-116 Reuse highlighter in forge-tui logs tab
body: Integrate same parser/renderer into Rust TUI logs view for consistency with CLI. Add shared-library boundary tests to prevent divergence.

title: TUI-000 Epic: Forge Next-Gen TUI program
body: Program umbrella for a next-generation operator-first TUI. Scope includes interaction model, logs intelligence, fleet controls, swarm orchestration, analytics, collaboration, reliability, and extensibility. Exit when all child epics deliver parity plus clearly better operator outcomes.

title: TUI-100 Epic: Navigation, command palette, and workspace UX
body: Build a keyboard-first, low-friction navigation model with command palette, global search, layout presets, and session continuity. Success metric: common operator workflows complete without context switching or CLI fallback.

title: TUI-200 Epic: Logs intelligence and semantic rendering
body: Deliver harness-grade logs experience with semantic rendering, compare workflows, timeline navigation, and actionable error focus. Must exceed baseline CLI readability and troubleshooting speed.

title: TUI-300 Epic: Fleet control and safety rails
body: Provide safe, fast control for large loop fleets including bulk operations, health scoring, stale detection, and guarded emergency controls.

title: TUI-400 Epic: Run and task analytics cockpit
body: Expose throughput, cycle time, blockers, readiness, and trend views for execution planning and bottleneck removal.

title: TUI-500 Epic: Swarm orchestration cockpit
body: Enable launch/ramp/monitor/wind-down workflows for multi-agent swarms with policy and stop-condition awareness.

title: TUI-600 Epic: Collaboration and handoff flows
body: Integrate fmail, ownership signals, handoffs, and coordination telemetry to reduce duplicate work and stale in-progress tasks.

title: TUI-700 Epic: Reliability, replay, and performance
body: Guarantee responsive rendering and operational resilience under heavy load; include replay and incident workflows.

title: TUI-800 Epic: Personalization and accessibility
body: Support themes, density modes, macro ergonomics, and terminal-aware accessibility defaults.

title: TUI-900 Epic: Plugin and extension platform
body: Create controlled extension points for custom panels, actions, and automation integration without destabilizing core UX.

title: TUI-101 Information architecture: views, panes, and navigation graph
body: Define canonical view graph (overview, fleet, logs, tasks, analytics, swarm, inbox, incidents). Specify pane transitions and focus behavior. Add test matrix for deterministic focus movement.

title: TUI-102 Command palette core with action registry and fuzzy ranking
body: Implement Ctrl+P palette with typed command/action registry, recency bias, and context-aware ranking. Include search latency budget and deterministic ranking tests.

title: TUI-103 Keyboard mapping engine + conflict detector
body: Create centralized keybinding layer with per-view scopes and collision detection. Provide conflict diagnostics panel and snapshot tests for keymap resolution.

title: TUI-104 Layout preset system (ops/dev/review/night)
body: Persist and restore multi-pane layouts. Provide preset schema versioning and migration path. Include resilience tests for corrupted layout state.

title: TUI-105 Global search index across loops, runs, tasks, and logs
body: Build incremental searchable index with repo/profile/tag filters. Include partial-match semantics and ranking by relevance and recency.

title: TUI-106 Session restore and delta digest
body: Restore previous context (selected loop, filters, panes) and show what changed since last session. Include opt-out controls and privacy-safe storage.

title: TUI-201 Multi-lane log model (thinking/tool/stdout/stderr/events)
body: Normalize heterogeneous harness output into lane model. Preserve raw line fidelity while enabling lane-specific styling and filtering.

title: TUI-202 Query language for log filtering and drill-down
body: Design and implement log query syntax with field filters, boolean ops, and regex guardrails. Add parser golden tests and error diagnostics.

title: TUI-203 Timeline scrubber with density heatmap
body: Add time navigation with heatmap indicators for high activity and errors. Ensure smooth seek on large logs and stable cursor anchoring.

title: TUI-204 Failure jump and root-cause focus mode
body: Implement jump-to-first-failure and chain-to-root-cause shortcuts. Highlight cause lines and linked command context.

title: TUI-205 Cross-loop log compare with synchronized scroll
body: Render two loop logs side-by-side with synchronized time/line anchors and diff hints. Add compare-mode interaction tests.

title: TUI-206 Bookmark and annotation system for log anchors
body: Allow local bookmarks and lightweight annotations on log regions. Include export/import of anchors for handoff.

title: TUI-301 Fleet selection engine with expressive filters
body: Build selection primitives by id prefix, name, repo, profile, pool, state, tag, stale status. Support previews before action execution.

title: TUI-302 Bulk action planner for stop/scale/msg/inject
body: Implement batch action planning with dry-run summary, conflict checks, and rollback hints. Ensure action queue transparency.

title: TUI-303 Safety policies and destructive-action guardrails
body: Add confirmations, policy-aware blocking, and escalation hints for risky operations. Include policy override audit trail.

title: TUI-304 Loop health score and SLA timers
body: Compute per-loop health from liveness, queue age, error rate, and run recency. Surface SLA breaches and probable causes.

title: TUI-305 Stale in-progress detector and takeover suggestions
body: Flag stale loops/tasks with timeout policy and recommended recovery actions. Include false-positive mitigation controls.

title: TUI-306 Emergency safe-stop-all workflow
body: Provide one-key emergency stop path with scope preview, staged execution, and post-stop integrity checks.

title: TUI-401 Unified fact model for runs, tasks, queues, and agents
body: Define analytics data model and derivation rules. Include schema docs and consistency checks against source repositories.

title: TUI-402 Throughput and cycle-time dashboards
body: Implement charts and tabular summaries for run throughput, task cycle time, queue aging, and completion velocity.

title: TUI-403 Blocker graph and dependency bottleneck view
body: Visualize task blockers/dependencies and identify bottlenecks by impact. Add drill-down links to actionable tasks.

title: TUI-404 Readiness board with priority and risk overlays
body: Create board view combining readiness, priority, stale risk, and ownership gaps. Include filters for projects and epics.

title: TUI-405 Next-best-task recommendation engine
body: Recommend candidate tasks per operator context using priority, readiness, dependency, and ownership signals.

title: TUI-406 Daily summary export for operator handoff
body: Generate concise daily summary artifact including completed work, blockers, incidents, and next actions.

title: TUI-501 Swarm template library and spawn presets
body: Ship reusable topology templates (small/medium/full). Include profile maps, concurrency caps, and guardrail defaults.

title: TUI-502 Controlled ramp-up wizard with health gates
body: Guide scale progression and enforce preflight checks between stages. Block expansion on missing health signals.

title: TUI-503 Concurrency governor and pool starvation prevention
body: Track harness usage and automatically suggest/execute throttles to avoid queue starvation and profile exhaustion.

title: TUI-504 Dogpile detector and redistribution assistant
body: Detect duplicate task pickup patterns and propose rebalancing actions across active loops.

title: TUI-505 Quant and qual stop-condition monitor
body: Surface stop-signal status for each loop/swarm, including thresholds, time-to-trigger, and mismatch reasons.

title: TUI-506 Wind-down workflow with final state reconciliation
body: Support graceful stop sequences with stale check, ledger sync, and closure summary generation.

title: TUI-601 fmail inbox panel with threading and quick actions
body: Embed inbox with filters, unread tracking, and quick reply/ack actions. Preserve CLI parity for ids and threading.

title: TUI-602 Claim feed and ownership conflict alerts
body: Display task claim timeline and detect conflicting claims. Provide safe resolution workflows.

title: TUI-603 Handoff snapshot generator
body: Generate compact handoff package per task/loop including status, context, links, and pending risks.

title: TUI-604 Shared notes and breadcrumbs per task
body: Add lightweight notes pane attached to tasks with timestamped breadcrumbs and author attribution.

title: TUI-605 Activity stream by agent, repo, and task
body: Provide real-time stream of relevant actions with filters and jump links to logs and tasks.

title: TUI-606 Communication quality checks and stale-thread alerts
body: Detect unanswered asks, stale coordination threads, and missing closure notes. Suggest corrective actions.

title: TUI-701 Incremental render engine and diff-based repaint
body: Implement render diffing to minimize terminal writes and improve high-frequency update performance.

title: TUI-702 Data polling pipeline with backpressure and jitter control
body: Ensure stable refresh cadence under load with bounded queues and controlled jitter to avoid thundering herds.

title: TUI-703 Crash-safe state persistence and recovery
body: Persist minimal state snapshots and recover gracefully after crashes without corrupting user state.

title: TUI-704 Incident replay mode and timeline reconstruction
body: Implement replay from recorded events/logs for postmortem analysis with time controls and annotations.

title: TUI-705 Performance benchmark suite and SLO gates
body: Define latency and throughput SLOs for key views. Add automated benchmarks and regression gates in CI.

title: TUI-706 Resilience test matrix for degraded environments
body: Test behavior under missing profiles, DB lock contention, partial data, and network interruptions.

title: TUI-801 Theme packs with semantic color slots
body: Create curated themes with semantic slots mapped to statuses and token classes. Include export/import support.

title: TUI-802 Accessibility contrast validator
body: Add automated contrast checks across supported themes and terminal capabilities with fail-fast report.

title: TUI-803 Density modes and focus mode
body: Support compact and comfortable density plus distraction-minimized focus mode for deep debugging.

title: TUI-804 Keyboard macro recorder and runner
body: Allow users to record and replay common key sequences safely with reviewable macro definitions.

title: TUI-805 Adaptive capability detection (ANSI16/256/truecolor)
body: Detect terminal capability at runtime and adjust palette and styles without breaking readability.

title: TUI-806 Configurable status strip and widget slots
body: Provide customizable top/bottom status strips with pluggable widgets and persisted ordering.

title: TUI-901 Extension API for custom panels
body: Define stable API for custom read-only and interactive panels, including lifecycle and rendering contracts.

title: TUI-902 Extension API for custom actions and palette commands
body: Allow extensions to register validated commands/actions with permissions and audit metadata.

title: TUI-903 Sandbox and permission model for extensions
body: Enforce capability restrictions and explicit grants for extension behaviors touching filesystem or process actions.

title: TUI-904 Event bus and schema versioning for plugins
body: Publish versioned internal events and compatibility rules to keep plugins stable across releases.

title: TUI-905 Plugin packaging, discovery, and lifecycle management
body: Implement packaging format, install/uninstall, signature checks, and runtime lifecycle controls.

title: TUI-906 Reference plugins and extension developer docs
body: Ship reference implementations and docs to accelerate ecosystem adoption and reduce unsafe patterns.

title: E1: rforged daemon process serves and stays up
body: Outcome: rforged is a persistent gRPC daemon, not a placeholder exit.\nDoD: real server loop + graceful shutdown + startup diagnostics.

title: E1.1: replace daemon_main placeholder with tonic serve loop
body: Implement server bootstrap in rust/crates/forge-daemon/src/bin/shared/daemon_main.rs.\nAccept: process stays alive, serves forged.v1 RPCs, no crate-label placeholder print.

title: E1.2: add SIGINT/SIGTERM graceful shutdown and runner drain
body: Wire tokio signal handling and ordered shutdown.\nAccept: StopLoopRunner/stop_all invoked on shutdown; clean exit code; no zombie loop-runner children.

title: E1.3: honor --config path and merged config on daemon startup
body: Current startup ignores --config content.\nAccept: daemon uses provided config file + env overrides + defaults, and logs effective bind target.

title: E1.4: integration test rforged stays alive and answers Ping/GetStatus
body: Add test that spawns rforged binary and calls Ping/GetStatus via forged.v1 client.\nAccept: server responds until test sends termination signal.

title: E1.5: startup failure diagnostics (bind conflict/bad config)
body: Add deterministic failure messages and tests.\nAccept: clear stderr/log message + non-zero exit + test coverage.

title: E2: forge-cli spawn-owner daemon/auto parity
body: Outcome: up/scale/resume daemon spawn owner uses real daemon RPC path with Go parity semantics.

title: E2.1: add forge-cli daemon RPC client wrapper
body: Create reusable client module for forged.v1 dial + timeout + ping preflight.\nAccept: unit tests for dial errors, timeout handling, target resolution.

title: E2.2: implement spawn_loop daemon path via StartLoopRunner
body: Replace fake uuid return in rust/crates/forge-cli/src/spawn_loop.rs for owner=daemon.\nAccept: uses RPC response instance_id; returns error when daemon unavailable.

title: E2.3: implement auto mode daemon-first with local fallback warning
body: Match Go semantics: auto tries daemon then local fallback, warning suppressed in quiet/json/jsonl.\nAccept: behavior and messaging parity tests pass.

title: E2.4: send config_path + command_path fields in StartLoopRunner request
body: Pass command path and config from CLI path to daemon.\nAccept: request payload parity with internal/cli/loop_spawn.go behavior.

title: E2.5: unit regression suite for local/daemon/auto spawn branches
body: Cover success + failure matrix, warning gating, and metadata values persisted by up/scale/resume.

title: E3: daemon-owned loop lifecycle parity (stop/status/stale/resume)
body: Outcome: daemon-owned loops are controlled and reported using daemon truth, not stub metadata.

title: E3.1: daemon-owned stop path calls StopLoopRunner RPC
body: When runner_owner=daemon, stop commands must stop daemon runner first.\nAccept: runner state and loop state converge.

title: E3.2: ps/status merge daemon loop-runner liveness
body: Populate runner_liveness using Get/ListLoopRunners data when owner=daemon.\nAccept: running/sleeping/stopped rendering matches actual daemon runner state.

title: E3.3: resume with --spawn-owner daemon uses real instance_id
body: Replace synthetic resume-* ids with daemon response instance_id.\nAccept: metadata.runner_instance_id equals daemon runner instance.

title: E3.4: stale reconciliation consults daemon runner before marking stale
body: Use daemon runner state to avoid false stale on daemon-owned loops.\nAccept: stale decisions match Go semantics and existing stale tests extended.

title: E3.5: lifecycle regression tests for daemon-owned loops
body: Add command tests for stop/resume/status/stale with daemon ownership transitions.

title: E4: rforged e2e gate + docs
body: Outcome: reproducible end-to-end proof that daemon mode executes real work and is operator-documented.

title: E4.1: tmp-repo e2e: rforged + rforge up --spawn-owner daemon
body: Run >1 iteration with real harness, verify repo side-effect, run rows, logs, and clean stop.

title: E4.2: multi-loop daemon e2e (3 loops) + id-prefix targeting
body: Verify short-id prefix resolution, ps/logs targeting, concurrent loop behavior, and bulk stop.

title: E4.3: CI gate target for daemon runtime parity suite
body: Add make/script target + CI wiring for daemon runtime bring-up tests.

title: E4.4: docs refresh quickstart/runbook/troubleshooting for rforged
body: Document launch, health checks, failure modes, and recovery commands for daemon mode.

title: M10.1: Agent model + lifecycle state machine
body:
Scope:
- Define canonical Agent model: id, parent_subagent_id/parent_agent_id, workspace/repo, node, harness, mode, state, created_at, last_activity_at, ttl, labels/tags.
- Define state machine: starting -> idle/working/awaiting_approval -> idle ... -> stopped/error/expired.
- Define transitions + invariants (e.g. send only when agent exists; revive only from stopped/error/expired).
- Define mapping between forged AgentState and new SubagentState.
- Define contract for "continuous" vs "one-shot" agents.

Deliverables:
- Design doc in docs/design/agent-lifecycle.md
- State diagram + transition table.
- Error taxonomy (not_found, not_interactive, dead_subagent, transport_unavailable, timeout_waiting_idle, policy_denied).

Acceptance:
- All agent commands reference same state definitions.
- No ambiguous transitions.
- Edge cases documented: daemon restart, pane missing, process exit, approval wait.

Tests:
- Unit tests for transition validator.

title: M10: Persistent agents (non-loop delegation)
body:
Goal:
- Add first-class persistent agents for non-loop workflows.
- Parent agent can spawn child, send one-off work, then continue chatting with same child on demand.
- Keep agents alive between tasks; support revive/resume when possible.

Problem:
- Current loop-first UX good for continuous repo loops, poor fit for ad-hoc delegated one-off + re-engage workflow.
- Existing forged RPC has spawn/send primitives, but no stable end-user agent primitive in forge CLI.

Scope:
- New agent lifecycle primitive (spawn/send/wait/list/interrupt/kill/revive).
- Explicit harness capability handling (interactive vs one-shot modes).
- Parent-focused delegation helper command for low-friction use.
- Persistence, observability, safety policies, docs.

Out of scope:
- Replacing loop runtime.
- Full autonomous team routing system (covered by M7+).

Success metrics:
- Parent can re-use same child agent across multiple delegated tasks in one day.
- Median command count for delegated task <= 3 commands.
- Failed delegation due to dead/non-interactive agent reduced via capability checks and revive path.

Acceptance:
- CLI agent flow works end-to-end locally and with forged daemon.
- Harness mismatch errors are explicit/actionable.
- Agent state is inspectable and auditable.

title: M10.3: Agent service on top of forged transport
body:
Scope:
- Implement forged-backed Agent service APIs using existing SpawnAgent/SendInput/List/Get/Kill primitives.
- Add abstraction so agent ops can run local or daemon-backed consistently.
- Implement operations: SpawnSubagent, SendMessage, WaitState, InterruptSubagent, KillSubagent, ListSubagents, GetSubagent.
- Store each operation in subagent_events.
- Normalize transport errors.

Acceptance:
- Service can manage multiple concurrent agents.
- WaitState works for idle/working/approval/stopped with timeout.
- Failures emit structured events and retain debug context.

Tests:
- Unit tests with mocked forged client.
- Integration test with local forged daemon for spawn/send/wait/kill.

title: M10.5: Parent-oriented forge agent run helper
body:
Scope:
- Add high-level parent-helper command:
  - forge agent run "task" [--agent <id>] [--type codex] [--wait idle] [--revive]
- Behavior:
  - if agent exists: reuse.
  - else spawn with requested/default profile.
  - send task.
  - optionally wait for idle/completion marker.
  - return summary payload for parent automation.
- Include ergonomic flags for label/tag/task-id correlation.

Acceptance:
- One command handles common delegation loop.
- Re-run with same --agent continues prior callee context.
- Output includes subagent_id + observed state + quick tail.

Tests:
- Integration tests for create/reuse/revive paths.

title: M10.4: CLI surface for forge agent commands
body:
Scope:
- Add CLI group: forge agent.
- Subcommands:
  - forge agent spawn
  - forge agent send
  - forge agent wait
  - forge agent ps
  - forge agent show
  - forge agent interrupt
  - forge agent kill
  - forge agent revive
- Add JSON output contracts for automation.
- Define rename behavior for legacy command `forge subagent` (hard break vs temporary compatibility alias) and standardize error/warning text.
- Add context-aware defaults (workspace, last agent, parent marker) without hidden magic.

Acceptance:
- Non-interactive automation works with --json.
- Human UX concise and predictable.
- Errors provide next-step hints.

Tests:
- CLI tests for parse/validation.
- Golden tests for JSON output envelopes.

title: M10.12: End-to-end and regression test matrix
body:
Scope:
- Build comprehensive test matrix:
  - spawn/send/wait/interrupt/kill/revive
  - capability mismatch paths
  - daemon unavailable fallback errors
  - multi-agent concurrency
- Add regression tests for known pitfalls:
  - one-shot harness used as continuous agent
  - stale pane ID after restart
  - legacy `forge subagent` command path follows chosen policy (explicit failure or compatibility alias)

Acceptance:
- CI includes agent flow tests with stable fixtures.
- Failures isolate root cause quickly.

title: M10.13: Docs and troubleshooting for delegated agents
body:
Scope:
- Docs updates:
  - README section for agent workflows.
  - docs/cli.md agent commands + examples.
  - docs/quickstart.md delegation recipe.
  - docs/troubleshooting.md agent failure playbook.
- Add explicit harness-mode guidance (interactive vs one-shot).
- Add migration note: old `forge subagent` naming replaced by `forge agent`, with exact upgrade examples.

Acceptance:
- New user can run delegated continuous agent flow in <10 min.
- Docs include at least 3 real command recipes.
